seisflows3.system.cluster

The Cluster class provides the core utilities interaction with HPC systems which must be overloaded by subclasses for specific workload managers, or specific clusters.

Module Contents

Classes

Cluster

Abstract base class for the Systems module which controls interaction with

seisflows3.system.cluster.PATH
class seisflows3.system.cluster.Cluster(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: custom_import('system', 'base')

Abstract base class for the Systems module which controls interaction with compute systems such as HPC clusters.

logger
property required(self)

A hard definition of paths and parameters required by this class, alongside their necessity for the class and their string explanations.

check(self, validate=True)

Checks parameters and paths

submit(self, submit_call)

Main insertion point of SeisFlows3 onto the compute system.

$ seisflows submit

Note

The expected behavior of the submit() function is to: 1) run system setup, creating directory structure, 2) execute workflow by submitting workflow.main()

Parameters

  • workflow (seisflows3.workflow) – an active seisflows3 workflow instance

  • submit_call (str) – the command line workload manager call to be run by subprocess. These need to be passed in by specific workload manager subclasses.

abstract run(self, classname, method, **kwargs)

Runs a task multiple times in parallel

Note

The expected behavior of the run() function is to: submit N jobs to the system in parallel. For example, in a simulation step, run() submits N jobs to the compute system where N is the number of events requiring an adjoint simulation.

Return type

None

Returns

This function is not expected to return anything

abstract taskid(self)

Provides a unique identifier for each running task. This is compute system specific.

Return type

int

Returns

this function is expected to return a unique numerical identifier.
